title: Calories in Sweet Potato Fries
meta_description: Discover calories in sweet potato fries per 100g, including carbs, protein, fat, and nutrition tweaks for baked or fried versions.
assumptions: Homemade, oven-baked with 1 tsp oil per 100g, cut into fries, lightly salted; no additional sauces.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by preparation method, oil amount, potato size, and brand; deep-frying increases calories. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of oven-baked sweet potato fries contains ~195 kcal and ~30g carbs.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g sweet potato fries?
faqs.a: About 195 kcal for oven-baked with minimal oil.

faqs.q: Are sweet potato fries healthier than regular fries?
faqs.a: Yes, higher in fiber and vitamins, but calories depend on oil usedâ€”baked versions are lower in fat.

faqs.q: What's the carb content in sweet potato fries?
faqs.a: ~30g carbs per 100g, including 4g fiber and 7g sugars.

faqs.q: Do sweet potato fries have protein?
How does frying affect calories in sweet potato fries?
faqs.a: Deep-frying can add 100+ kcal per 100g due to absorbed oil.
